summary: An ordinance directing the City Comptroller to cancel and destroy Three Hundred Seventy Thousand Dollars ($370,000) Series "B" Bridge Bonds, 1916, voted march 2, 1915, under and pursuant to Ordinance No. 34220, entitled: "An ordinance submitting to the qualified voters of the City of Seattle, at the general election to be held in such city on Tuesday, March 2, 1915, the proposition of the issuance and sale by said city of its general bonds in the sum of Five Hundred Forty-five Thousand Dollars ($545,000) for the purpose of providing money for the construction of a bridge for the City of Seattle, across Lake Union along the line of Eastlake Avenue produced northeasterly", approved January 26, 1915.
